### Some more details:

* The new formula for heading error is:

    * 𝐸𝐻𝐸𝐴𝐷= 1−||𝜃−𝜃'|−𝜋|/𝜋
    * where 𝜃_'_ is the goal heading and
    * 𝜃 is the current heading.
    
* This looks like:

    * ![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/2947088722-desmos-graph.png)
    
* The new poseError using this formula is:

    * 𝐸_POSE_ = sqrt\(\(x - x'\)^2 \+ \(y - y'\)^2\) \+ 𝐸𝐻𝐸𝐴𝐷
    
* The old poseError was simply:

    * 𝐸_POSE_ = sqrt\(\(x - x'\)^2 \+ \(y - y'\)^2 \+ \(𝜃 -𝜃'\)^2 \)
    * This was pretty weird because if the goal heading was at 0 and your heading was 6.2 it would penalize you as though you were 6 meters away, but if you turned a tiny bit to the left the penalty would abruptly drop.

  • The new formula for heading error is:

    • 𝐸𝐻𝐸𝐴𝐷= 1−||𝜃−𝜃'|−𝜋|/𝜋
    • where 𝜃' is the goal heading and
    • 𝜃 is the current heading.

  • This looks like:

  • The new poseError using this formula is:

    • 𝐸POSE = sqrt((x - x')^2 + (y - y')^2) + 𝐸𝐻𝐸𝐴𝐷

  • The old poseError was simply:

    • 𝐸POSE = sqrt((x - x')^2 + (y - y')^2 + (𝜃 -𝜃')^2 )
    • This was pretty weird because if the goal heading was at 0 and your heading was 6.2 it would penalize you as though you were 6 meters away, but if you turned a tiny bit to the left the penalty would abruptly drop.
